patterns: What are the option for branches in Engineering ?
responses: NIST B.Tech program offers: Computer Science and Engineering, Electronics and Communication Engineering, Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Information Technology, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, and Civil Engineering.

patterns: What's the admission procedure for B.tech ?
responses: Admission criteria to B.Tech includes the performance in the class 12/equivalent examination and Joint Entrance Examination, JEE (Main).

patterns: What's the admission procedure for B.Com ?
responses: Students having an academic background of commerce or science at 10+2 level can pursue B.Com (Hon) program at NIST. Admissions are done on the basis of students' merit in 10+2 examinations in commerce or science stream. The fees is according to the guidelines prescribed by the Government of Odisha.

patterns: What's the admission procedure for B.Sc ?
responses: Students having an academic background of science at 10+2 level can pursue B.Sc program. At NIST, we offer B.Sc Honours programs in PCM (Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics) stream, affiliated to Berhampur University. Admissions are done on the basis of students' merit in 10+2 examinations.

patterns: What is the admission procedure for MBA ?
responses: Bachelor's degree from any recognized University or Institution can apply for MBA at NIST. Admissions are done through Odisha Joint Entrance Examination (O-JEE) and All India Management Aptitudes Test (MAT).

patterns: What is the admission procedure for MCA ?
responses: Admission to MCA is through the JEE conducted each year in May/June by Government of Odisha. The minimum eligibility for appearing in JEE is pass in +3 with Mathematics at +2 level. Reservation for SC/ST, handicapped, Women, Military, Green Card and outside State Quota is available. Five percent of the total intake is reserved for NRI/In-lieu of NRI quota.

patterns: What is the admission procedure for M.Sc ?
responses: Applicant must have passed B.Sc with (Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics) or equivalent as recognized by Berhampur University and fulfill the minimum qualifying marks (45% for general category, and 40% for reserved).

patterns: What is the admission procedure for M.Tech ?
responses: Admission is done through the OJEE counselling. Preference is given to candidates having a valid GATE score. Non-GATE candidates having a minimum of 60% in aggregate OR CGPA of 6.5/10 at B.Tech./B.E level can also apply. Students with B.E/B.Tech/MCA in the relevant discipline are eligible to apply.
